title: Feminine Plurals (-a/-i -> -es).
reading_greek: Οι τσάντες είναι μεγάλες. Οι μπλούζες είναι μαύρες. Αυτές οι καρέκλες είναι άδειες.
reading_english: The bags are big. The blouses are black. These chairs are empty.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 5 of your Greek course. Today we are focusing on feminine plurals... specifically, nouns ending in -a or -i in the singular, which change to -es in the plural. This change also applies to the adjectives that describe them... So 'η τσάντα' becomes 'οι τσάντες' (the bags)... and 'η μπλούζα' becomes 'οι μπλούζες' (the blouses)... Listen closely to the following short reading passage, which uses this plural form... Οι τσάντες είναι μεγάλες. Οι μπλούζες είναι μαύρες. Αυτές οι καρέκλες είναι άδειες... Let's break down the key examples... The singular feminine ending -a changes to -es... The singular feminine ending -i also changes to -es... Remember, both the noun and the adjective change to -es... For example, the big bag... η μεγάλη τσάντα... becomes the big bags... οι μεγάλες τσάντες... Now, repeat the reading passage after me... Οι τσάντες είναι μεγάλες... Οι μπλούζες είναι μαύρες... Αυτές οι καρέκλες είναι άδειες... Excellent. Practice these changes throughout the week!
